uk: Late payments averaging 54.1 days—7% increase year-on-year, creating cash flow crises
Retentions held back 5-10% until project completion, tying up working capital for months
CIS compliance complexity: monthly returns, deduction statements, and HMRC record-keeping
CIS reform 2026: SDC (supervision, direction, control) reclassification risk for subcontractors
Project margin compression: material costs 15-20% higher than pre-pandemic, eroding profitability
VAT reverse charge complexity: accounting for VAT differently on subcontractor invoices
Making Tax Digital (MTD) compliance: digital record-keeping and API integration requirements
HMRC compliance audits: risk of penalties for incorrect CIS returns or VAT treatment
Project-based accounting: tracking profitability by job, not just overall business performance
Cash flow forecasting: predicting gaps when payments are delayed or retentions are held
Employment status confusion: contractor vs employee classification affecting PAYE liability
Regulatory uncertainty: planning policy changes, Building Safety Levy, net-zero compliance costs
uae: UAE VAT compliance: 5% VAT on all construction services, no exemptions
Retention payment VAT timing: VAT due before cash received, creating cash flow pressure
Delayed input tax recovery: extended periods before claiming input tax credits on materials
Advance payment VAT treatment: uncertainty about when VAT liability is triggered
Snagging and defect correction VAT: distinguishing between covered and uncovered work
Place-of-supply disputes: cross-border projects creating VAT classification ambiguity
FTA compliance audits: risk of penalties for late registration, incorrect returns, or late payment
Subcontractor VAT compliance: general contractors bear risk if subcontractors fail to comply
Project-based accounting: tracking profitability by job across multiple jurisdictions
UK-UAE dual-country accounting: managing compliance across two tax systems
Contract structuring complexity: defining VAT terms for milestones, retentions, variations
Tax technology requirements: managing VAT tracking across multiple projects and contractors

uk.response: Do they specialize in construction? CIS compliance, project-based accounting, and construction cash flow require specialist knowledge. We're construction accountants, not generalists.

uk.objection: We can't afford specialist construction accounting
uk.response: Construction accounting mistakes cost more than specialist help. CIS penalties, HMRC audits, and project margin errors can cost thousands. We help you avoid costly mistakes.

uk.objection: We're too small for construction accounting specialists
uk.response: Construction accounting challenges affect businesses of all sizes. CIS compliance, retentions, and project margins matter whether you're a sole trader or a developer. We work with businesses of all sizes.
Construction accounting is complex: CIS, VAT reverse charge, project-based costing, and HMRC compliance. We handle the complexity so you can focus on building. Free consultation to show you how.
